data.title: Junior Darts Corporation
data.meta_description:
The JDC structure allows people passionate about darts to get involved at grassroots helping juniors enjoy the game
The JDC is built on good sportsmanship, having fun and playing in a non pressured environment
data.text:
ARCHIE SELF IS CROWNED 2024 ADVANCED TOUR CHAMPION

ARCHIE Self is the Advanced Tour champion after he was runner-up in both events on the final day of competition on the 2024 tour.

The 14-year-old Englishman is the new junior world number one and will captain England A at the World Cup in Gibraltar after finishing five points ahead of Jack Nankervis at the top of the rankings.

Self, from Thatcham in Berkshire, was beaten in both finals by Ryan Branley, who booked his spot in the England A team in the process.

A special mention should also go to Nankervis, who went into the final day one point behind Self. Their quarter-final meeting in Event 15, which Self won in a deciding leg, was arguably the decisive moment in the race to be crowned champion.

Read more ...

NANKERVIS WINS EVENT 14 TO SET UP DRAMATIC FINAL DAY ON ADVANCED TOUR

JACK Nankervis won Event 14 – and reached the semi-final in Event 13 – to move within one point of overall Advanced Tour leader Archie Self with two events to play tomorrow.

Self came into the weekend with a six-point lead at the top of the rankings – but single-leg defeats in the Event 13 quarter-final and Event 14 last 16 saw his advantage cut to a single point.

Read more ...

LAWRIE IS CROWNED FOUNDATION TOUR CHAMPION AS HOWARTH SIGNS OFF WITH A WIN

MITCHELL Lawrie is the 2024 Foundation Tour champion after winning a record-breaking seventh event of the season – while Jack Howarth signed off with a sixth event win of the tour.

Lawrie, the 13-year-old Scot, beat Jack Nankervis’ 2023 haul of six titles when he won the Event 19 title on Sunday afternoon, guaranteeing the overall title in the process.

Then, in a fitting final match of the tour season, Lawrie faced Howarth – his closest rival throughout the campaign – with the 17-year-old Englishman winning 5-1 to cap an excellent season for him personally.

Between them, Lawrie and Howarth won 13 of the 20 events – so the two of them contesting another final was an apt way for the Foundation Tour to conclude.

Read more ...
